content:
The Scale

Chorley Borough Council's spending data reveals £330.9 million in external payments across 17,212 transactions with 1,786 unique suppliers from 2021/22 to 2024/25.

With a population of 118,300, this works out at approximately £699 per resident per year — the second highest in Lancashire after Burnley.

The Lancashire County Council Question

The most striking feature of Chorley's spending is the dominance of a single supplier. Lancashire County Council receives £148.5 million — a staggering 43.9% of all spending. This reflects the two-tier local government structure where district councils pay the county council for shared services.

Supplier Concentration

Chorley's HHI score of 2,131 indicates moderate supplier concentration — the highest of any council we track. The top 10 suppliers receive over 80% of all spending. This high concentration is largely driven by the LCC relationship.
